text:
Raskolnikov stared at the wall. 

“What money bought all this?” he asked. 

“Your own,” Razumihin replied. “The messenger brought it from Vahrushin. Your mother sent it.” 

Raskolnikov sighed. “I remember now.” 

Razumihin frowned, uneasy. 

The door creaked open. A tall, stout man entered. Raskolnikov felt a sense of déjà vu.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov reflects on the money sent by his mother while feeling sullen and uneasy.
